data.title: file associations should do the full thing
data.body:
#6657

Instead of adding only the `files.associations` part to the config, the _Configure File Associations_ action should show a seconds quick pick which allows me to select the language do all modification. Optionally it could reveal the changes it made.

data.title: The scrollbar thumb is not working correctly when opening a large document.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: windows 8.1

Steps to Reproduce:
1.  open a very large document, like typescript.js
2.  drag the vertical scrollbar thumb.

When mouse button click the thumb and start to move, the thumb will move up some pixels.

data.title: Support for multiple terminals
data.body:
I think pretty early on we will get the feature request to support multiple terminals. As soon as you run a program from the terminal, you cannot use it anymore. 

Maybe we just allow to create new terminals with an action from the terminal panel and show all opened terminals from a dropdown similar to output channels?

We did this in Monaco on Azure:

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/15492968/e747b8e8-2180-11e6-999f-0e6a822cb5c3.png)

data.title: Keep history in integrated terminal
data.body:
It would be nice to keep some state of the terminal between restarts:
- the history of commands typed
- the last output

data.title: View: Toggle Terminal => View: Toggle Integrated Terminal?
data.body: Maybe we should distinguish between the external and internal terminal when you pick it from the command palette.

data.title: [JS] Autocomplete should sort based on local variables
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0
- OS Version: OSX El Capitan 10.11

The autocomplete should always prefer displaying the user variables, if possible sort by scope, local variables first.

I find frustrating to type a couple of letters and still get a bunch of code snippets I never use.

You might have a reason for that, maybe other people use those snippets far more than the local variables, then it would be great to be able to disable the snippets and `window.*`.

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open a JavaScript file, 
2. Add `var eventData = "hi";` and `var eventName = "hello"`
3. Type `ev` in the next line.

![screen shot 2016-05-23 at 11 19 22 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/4248124/15492065/d3189656-213c-11e6-8977-783deba745af.png)

data.title: Test Quick fix support for tslint warnings
data.body:
- [x] test on any platform, as single platform is sufficient - *_@dbaeumer_

There is now support for quick fixing some `tslint` warnings.
The following warnings are supported:
- missing semicolon (known issue that light bulb only shows up at the end of the marker)
- ' should be "
- " should be '
- missing white space
- no trailing white space
- file should end with a newline

To test:
- side install the latest version of https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-tslint.git
- enable the rules that can be auto fixed in a tslint.json

``` json
{
    "rules": {
        "quotemark": [
            true,
            "double"
        ],
        "no-unreachable": true,
        "semicolon": [
            true,
            "always"
        ]
    }
}
```

data.title: Object definition detail popup was blocked by main window.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1
- OS Version: win7 64bit

Steps to Reproduce:
1. When the object is a little bit large, and you hover the instance of that object, vsc will show a popup window to show the definition of that object. But sometimes it's blocked by the main window border since it's a little bit big.

data.title: Create yotovlimited
Intellisense in not showing up when trying to add setting for "eslint.trace.server" and "tslint.trace.server"
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Latest alpha
- OS Version: Windows10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Launch app and open any folder which has .ts or .js file.
2. Update settings.json file for below properties (for Typescript add tslint and for JavaScript add eslint)
"tslint.trace.server":"messages" ,
or
 "eslint.trace.server":"messages"
3. Build solution or launch output window View->Toggle output.
4. Verify in the drop down you will get option for eslint or tslint.

Actual: The final output is coming properly but not getting any intellisense when trying to add property in settings.json file.

![eslint traceissue](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/17735796/15488624/12476558-210d-11e6-97c9-4b833b38e4eb.gif)

data.title: Extensibility API command for moving cursor to line.
Copying a text file into the Explorer window adds extra line

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Create a txt file on the desktop containing some text (ex. "test") on one line
2. Drag the file into the explorer window to copy it into the open folder in Code

When the file opens in Code there is an added newline at the end of the file. Opening the file on the desktop still shows the text on one line without any other lines.

data.title: Test: Add support for external grammar injections
data.body:
- [x] Win - **@alexandrudima**

You can now contribute injection grammars using the regular 'grammar' contribution point:

``` json
"grammars": [
            {
                "scopeName": "source.todo",
                "path": "./syntaxes/todo.json",
                "injectTo": [  "source.js", "source.ts" ]
            }
```

Check out https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-textmate/blob/master/test-cases/first-mate/fixtures/todo.json for an example of an injection grammar.
- Try to get the todo example to work.

data.title: Consider removing git dependency from deb and rpm
data.body: It's a soft requirement so can safely remove. Some people experience issues with downloading git during install.

data.title: Cannot use both dotnet and gulp tasks
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1
- OS Version: Linux/Mint

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Install DotNet Core RC2 & upgrade generator-aspnet
2. Scaffold a new Web Application
3. Open app in VS Code 1.1.1
4. Type F1, followed by task, select 'Run Task'

Expected:
List of Gulp tasks

Actual:
Build

Notes:
tasks.json is set up for "command": "dotnet".  If I delete this file and configure a new one for Gulp, I can enumerate my Gulp tasks, but F5 no longer works.
The documentation and file format seem to indicate that there's no way to configure _two_ task runners, so I see no way to run my DotNet Core app _and_ use Gulp.

I plan to use React.  I don't see how I can accomplish this w/o access to a task runner other than dotnet.  I _must_ configure both dotnet and gulp somehow.

data.title: Changing viewlets too quickly does not change view
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.0-alpha
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Open search viewlet
2. Quickly change to another viewlet (as if you accidentally clicked the wrong one)

The blue selection bar on the left changes to the other one but it still shows search.

data.title: Markdown preview handles escaping incorrectly
data.body:
Markdown preview rendered should treat `\<` as `<`, `\[` as `[` and so on
- VSCode Version:

Version 1.1.1
Commit def9e32467ad6e4f48787d38caf190acbfee5880
Date 2016-05-13T13:29:20.776Z
Shell 0.37.6
Renderer 49.0.2623.75
Node 5.10.0
- OS Version: Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:
1. create a file foo.md with content

```
SYNOPSIS
Add-GistFile -Id \<string\> -Path \<string\[\]\> \[\<CommonParameters\>\]
```
1. Open markdown preview for it
## Expected result

SYNOPSIS
Add-GistFile -Id <string> -Path <string[]> [<CommonParameters>]
## Actual result

![image](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/816680/15482457/9fd7a848-20e4-11e6-802c-5bfd58786412.png)

data.title: markdown.styles missing should not break markdown preview

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.1.1 
- OS Version: Windows 10 x64

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Pick Dark Theme 
2. Open a markdown file and toggle side by side preview, on the preview panel you will see the font color is white and the background color is dark.
3. Open user preference, add below config and make sure `markdown.css` doesn't exist in your workspace.
   
   "markdown.styles": [
      "markdown.css"
   ]

Now the font color in preview panel becomes black but the background remains dark, which makes the preview unreadable. Toggle develop tools and you'll see the error message saying `markdown.css` is missing. But we shouldn't break the preview, right?

Just open this issue as a reminder, once @kieferrm puts the markdown logic to a separate extension, let's see if this problem still exists.

data.title: Request: Add a "Reveal in Explorer" context menu item for Open Editors
data.body:
- VSCode Version: commit 91f14c4
- OS Version: OS X

Low priority, but it would be nice to have a "Reveal in Explorer" command within the right click menu of Open Editors.  I found myself wanting that there when I was using the latest build.  My goal was to rename a file that I had open, and I needed to see where it was in Explorer to do that.

data.title: Editor Stacks do not clean up from file deletes when switching branches
data.body: Regarding #6686 - VSCode Version: commit 91f14c441df40b80f14d0a04b3a4db816d579a3e - OS Version: OS X Steps to Reproduce: 1. Checkout a branch that has some unique files that no other branch has 2. Open one or more of those unique files 3. Now `git checkout` another branch that does not have these files. 4. Note that the files remain as open editors; however, when you click on any of them you get the unable to open error below. We should just simply close the editors.

data.title: Editor actions lost ability to detect CtrlCmd+click
data.body:
It looks like all editor actions now get passed in the IEditorIdentifier. However there were some actions expecting the mouse event as context to detect if the user wants to invoke the action "to the side".

For example: the preview markdown action would open to the side if you Cmd+click on it. Same for the diff action. 

I suggest we find a way that the context is enriched with this information and still carries around the IEditorIdentifier.
